flankFaceWear.detailReason: Flank face wear is caused by abrasion between the workpiece and the flank face.

craterWear.reason: Erosion or hollowing on the rake face
craterWear.detailReason: Crater wear is caused by erosion and abrasion on the rake face

buildUp.reason: Adhesion of material along the cutting edge on the rake face
buildUp.detailReason: Micro galling causes parts of the workpiece material to stick to the cutting edge, resulting in a build-up on the cutting edge.

fractures.detailReason: Fractures are caused by vibrations, chip impacts, thermal cracks and as a result of the wear resistance of the cutting tool material being too high.

plasticDeformation.reason: Deformation on the cutting edge (particularly on the corner radius)
plasticDeformation.detailReason: Plastic deformation is caused by excessive heat development combined with excessive mechanical stress.

notchWear.reason: Notching around the maximum cutting depth
notchWear.detailReason: Notch wear often occurs during the machining of workpieces with a hard surface (forged or cast).

thermalCracking.reason: Even cracks in the tool which are perpendicular to the cutting edge.
thermalCracking.detailReason: Thermal cracks are caused by fluctuations in temperature (thermal shock)

galling.reason: Galling on the rake faces or flank faces
galling.detailReason: Galling occurs due to unsuitable combinations of:  tool surface types, workpiece material properties and coolant properties.

mouldEdgeWear.detailReason: Mold edge wear is caused by abrasion between the workpiece and the mold edges.

reasonGalTf.reason: Galling - primarily on the mold edges but also in the flanks

galling_tf.detailReason: Galling occurs due to unsuitable combinations of:  tool surface types, workpiece material properties and coolant properties.

plasticDeformation_drillingRound.reason: Deformation on the cutting edge (especially on the corner edge)
plasticDeformation_drillingRound.detailReason: Plastic deformation is caused by excessive heat development combined with excessive mechanical stress.

detailFracTT.detailReason: Galling occurs due to unsuitable combinations of:  tool surface types, workpiece material properties and coolant properties.

fractures_tt.detailReason: Fractures on taps are often caused by problems with chip control

flankFaceWear_turning.detailReason: Flank face wear is caused by abrasion between the workpiece and the tool at the flank face of the indexable insert

fractures_turning.detailReason: Fractures are caused by vibration, interrupted cuts, chip impacts and thermal shocks in combination with cutting tool material substrates that are too hard
